Loads prompts from text files in the PROMPTS_DIR directory, ensuring file existence and proper encoding.
Uses OllamaClient to interact with the LLM service, relying on configuration settings for host and model parameters.
Defines an abstract BaseLLMClient class with methods for generating responses, processing messages, and streaming generation, ensuring secure interactions with the LLM service.
Manages a sequential flow of analysis stages using AgentExecutor to build upon previous findings, facilitating data access and processing.
Executes a single stage of the ladder, limiting tools if specified and injecting stage instructions into the agent's memory.
Interacts with the Ollama library to generate responses, process messages, and stream generation, relying on configuration settings for host and model parameters.

Defines a database table 'files' with columns project_id, path, hash, language, analyzed, summary, and last_analyzed_at. The relationship between File and Project is established through the project_id foreign key.
Establishes a one-to-many relationship between Project and File using the back_populates parameter.

Defines a database table 'tree_nodes' with columns project_id, path, priority, status, reason, and depth. The relationship between TreeNode and Project is established through the project_id foreign key.
Establishes a one-to-many relationship between Project and TreeNode using the back_populates parameter.

Defines a database table 'projects' with columns id, name, root_path, created_at, and updated_at. It also establishes relationships between Project and other tables (File, Fact, Relation, TreeNode) using the back_populates parameter.
Establishes one-to-many relationships between Project and various tables (File, Fact, Relation, TreeNode).

Defines a database table 'facts' with columns id, project_id, type, source, payload, confidence, and created_at. The relationship between Fact and Project is established through the project_id foreign key.
Establishes a one-to-many relationship between Project and Fact using the back_populates parameter.

Defines a database table 'relations' with columns project_id, from_node, to_node, relation, and source. The relationship between Relation and Project is established through the project_id foreign key.
Establishes a one-to-many relationship between Project and Relation using the back_populates parameter.

Uses SQLModel with asyncio session for database interactions, implementing CRUD operations for project entities.
Executes SQL queries using the session object to fetch project and file data, utilizing relationships for eager loading.
Utilizes SELECT statements with WHERE clauses to filter data by project ID and status (pending), implementing priority ordering via CASE statement.
